intro: Palicourea subtomentosa subsp. lojana, commonly known as the Lojana palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Native to the Andean regions of South America, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant's botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
